unit.unit_name: QM 求解器与方法实现

queries: [WEB] open source quantum chemistry software github
[WEB] density functional theory dft code github

tools.name: MOKIT
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular Orbital Kit for orbital transfer and multi-reference calculations
tools.detailed_description: MOKIT (Molecular Orbital KIT) provides utilities to transfer molecular orbitals between various quantum chemistry software packages and perform automatic multi-reference calculations. It addresses the compatibility issues between different wavefunction formats.

tools.name: coqui
tools.one_line_profile: Ab initio electronic structure software beyond DFT
tools.detailed_description: Coqui is an ab initio electronic structure package designed for calculations beyond standard density functional theory, implemented in C++ for performance.

tools.name: xtb_ase
tools.one_line_profile: ASE calculator interface for the xTB semi-empirical quantum chemistry code
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides a fully featured Atomic Simulation Environment (ASE) calculator for the Extended Tight Binding (xTB) program, enabling geometry optimizations and dynamics using xTB within ASE workflows.

tools.name: ebcc
tools.one_line_profile: Coupled cluster models for electron and electron-boson systems
tools.detailed_description: ebcc is a Python-based code for coupled cluster calculations, supporting both purely electronic systems and coupled electron-boson models. It emphasizes generality and extensibility for research in quantum many-body theory.

tools.name: Quax
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic differentiation for electronic structure methods
tools.detailed_description: Quax provides arbitrary-order derivatives of popular electronic structure methods (Hartree-Fock, Coupled Cluster) using automatic differentiation techniques, facilitating property calculations and optimization.

tools.name: CPMD
tools.one_line_profile: Car-Parrinello Molecular Dynamics package
tools.detailed_description: CPMD is a parallelized plane wave/pseudopotential implementation of Density Functional Theory, specifically designed for ab-initio molecular dynamics (Car-Parrinello method). It is a long-standing and widely used code in computational chemistry.

tools.name: Gaussium
tools.one_line_profile: Python-based Quantum Chemistry program
tools.detailed_description: Gaussium is a quantum chemistry program written in Python 3 that supports various methods including RHF, UHF, TDHF, CIS, MP2, DFT, CCSD, and CCSD(T), serving as a flexible solver for electronic structure problems.

tools.name: pycc
tools.one_line_profile: Reference implementation of coupled cluster methods
tools.detailed_description: PyCC is a Python-based reference implementation of the coupled cluster method for ab initio quantum chemistry, designed for educational purposes and as a testbed for new ideas in many-body theory.

tools.name: DMFTwDFT
tools.one_line_profile: Combination of DMFT with DFT packages
tools.detailed_description: DMFTwDFT is an open-source code that combines Dynamical Mean Field Theory (DMFT) with various Density Functional Theory (DFT) packages to treat strongly correlated electron systems.

tools.name: vaspvis
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization library for VASP electronic structure data
tools.detailed_description: vaspvis is a flexible Python library for visualizing electronic structure data (such as band structures and DOS) generated by VASP calculations, offering high customizability for publication-quality plots.

tools.name: PROFESS
tools.one_line_profile: Orbital-Free Electronic Structure Software
tools.detailed_description: PROFESS (PRinceton Orbital-Free Electronic Structure Software) is a code for performing orbital-free density functional theory (OF-DFT) calculations, enabling simulation of large systems where standard KS-DFT is too expensive.

tools.name: libxc
tools.one_line_profile: Library of exchange-correlation functionals for DFT
tools.detailed_description: Libxc is a library of exchange-correlation functionals for density-functional theory. It supports a wide variety of functionals (LDA, GGA, meta-GGA, hybrids) and is used by many major quantum chemistry codes.

tools.name: exachem
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale Quantum Chemistry Software
tools.detailed_description: ExaChem is an open-source quantum chemistry software package designed for exascale computing environments, focusing on high-performance implementations of electronic structure methods.

tools.name: Fermi.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Quantum chemistry framework in Julia
tools.detailed_description: Fermi.jl is a modern quantum chemistry framework written in the Julia programming language, offering high performance and ease of development for electronic structure methods.

tools.name: ECCE
tools.one_line_profile: Extensible Computational Chemistry Environment
tools.detailed_description: ECCE is a comprehensive problem-solving environment for computational chemistry, providing a graphical user interface for setting up calculations, managing jobs, and analyzing results from various quantum chemistry codes.

tools.name: ExPecto
tools.one_line_profile: Ab initio prediction of gene expression from sequence
tools.detailed_description: ExPecto is a deep learning framework that predicts tissue-specific gene expression directly from genetic sequences and estimates the disease impact of variants. (Note: Domain is Bioinformatics/Genomics, not Quantum Chemistry).

tools.name: GQCP
tools.one_line_profile: Ghent Quantum Chemistry Package
tools.detailed_description: The Ghent Quantum Chemistry Package (GQCP) is a software tool for performing electronic structure calculations, developed at Ghent University.

tools.name: pymatgen-io-espresso
tools.one_line_profile: Pymatgen addon for Quantum ESPRESSO I/O
tools.detailed_description: A specialized addon for the Pymatgen library that enhances support for parsing and generating input/output files for the Quantum ESPRESSO software suite.

tools.name: HopTB.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Tight-binding package in Julia
tools.detailed_description: HopTB.jl is a Julia package designed for performing tight-binding calculations, allowing for the construction and analysis of tight-binding models in condensed matter physics.

tools.name: TBFIT
tools.one_line_profile: Tight-binding parameter fitting package
tools.detailed_description: TBFIT is a package for fitting tight-binding parameters using the Slater-Koster method, facilitating the creation of accurate tight-binding models from first-principles data.

tools.name: AtomicOrbitals
tools.one_line_profile: Accurate Hartree-Fock Slater orbitals for atoms
tools.detailed_description: A Python module that implements accurate Hartree-Fock Slater orbitals for atoms under spherical symmetry, useful for generating atomic basis sets or initial guesses.

tools.name: LobsterPy
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic bonding analysis for LOBSTER
tools.detailed_description: LobsterPy is a Python package that automates the analysis of outputs from the LOBSTER program (Local Orbital Basis Suite Towards Electronic-Structure Reconstruction), enabling high-throughput bonding analysis.

tools.name: pyscf_TDDFT_ris
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient TDDFT-ris implementation based on MOKIT and PySCF
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the efficient TDDFT-ris method, leveraging MOKIT and PySCF libraries for quantum chemistry calculations.

tools.name: aiida-fleur
tools.one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for the FLEUR DFT code
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the AiiDA workflow engine that interfaces with the FLEUR code, enabling high-throughput density functional theory calculations.

tools.name: aiida-kkr
tools.one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for the JuKKR DFT code
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the AiiDA workflow engine that interfaces with the JuKKR code (KKR method), facilitating high-throughput electronic structure calculations.

tools.name: DFTK.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Density-functional toolkit in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A library of Julia algorithms for playing with plane-wave density-functional theory (DFT), providing a flexible platform for electronic structure calculations.

tools.name: qcmath
tools.one_line_profile: Mathematica modules for electronic structure calculations
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Mathematica modules designed to assist with electronic structure calculations and quantum chemistry derivations.

tools.name: Quantum Package
tools.one_line_profile: Quantum chemistry programs and libraries
tools.detailed_description: An open-source programming environment for quantum chemistry, focusing on wave function methods and configuration interaction.

tools.name: Qball
tools.one_line_profile: First-principles molecular dynamics code
tools.detailed_description: A first-principles molecular dynamics code used to compute the electronic structure of atoms, molecules, solids, and liquids within the Density Functional Theory (DFT) formalism.

tools.name: QuantumFoca.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular Integrals calculation in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia repository for calculating Molecular Integrals based on the O-ohata and Macmurchie-Davidson methods.

tools.name: AutoSolvate
tools.one_line_profile: Automated workflow for solvated molecule calculations
tools.detailed_description: An automated workflow tool for generating quantum chemistry calculations of explicitly solvated molecules, streamlining the setup of solvation shells.

tools.name: qeAPI
tools.one_line_profile: API between Quantum ESPRESSO and Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python interface/API for interacting with Quantum ESPRESSO, facilitating data exchange and automation.

tools.name: Express.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow framework for ab initio calculations
tools.detailed_description: A high-level, extensible workflow framework written in Julia for accelerating ab initio calculations in materials science.

tools.name: qha
tools.one_line_profile: Thermodynamic properties via quasi-harmonic approximation
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for calculating thermodynamic properties under the quasi-harmonic approximation using data from ab-initio calculations.

tools.name: psikit
tools.one_line_profile: Bridge between Psi4 and RDKit
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that integrates Psi4 (quantum chemistry) and RDKit (cheminformatics), enabling seamless workflows between molecular generation and quantum calculation.

tools.name: basis_set_exchange
tools.one_line_profile: Library for quantum chemistry basis sets
tools.detailed_description: A Python library and repository for accessing and managing quantum chemistry basis sets, providing a unified interface for various formats.

tools.name: QCElemental
tools.one_line_profile: Core data structures for quantum chemistry
tools.detailed_description: A library providing periodic table data, physical constants, and molecule parsing utilities for quantum chemistry applications.

tools.name: QCEngine
tools.one_line_profile: Quantum chemistry program executor
tools.detailed_description: A compute backend that interfaces with various quantum chemistry programs, standardizing input/output via QCSchema.

tools.name: QCFractal
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed compute platform for quantum chemistry
tools.detailed_description: A distributed compute and database platform for quantum chemistry, managing high-throughput calculations and data storage.

tools.name: QCSchema
tools.one_line_profile: Schema for Quantum Chemistry
tools.detailed_description: A library defining and implementing a standardized JSON schema for quantum chemistry data exchange.

tools.name: OpenMolcas
tools.one_line_profile: Multiconfigurational quantum chemistry software
tools.detailed_description: An open-source quantum chemistry software package specializing in multiconfigurational approaches to electronic structure.

tools.name: NWChemEx
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale-ready quantum chemistry software
tools.detailed_description: The next-generation, exascale-computing focused version of the NWChem computational chemistry software, designed for high-performance electronic structure calculations.

tools.name: ORCA Compound Scripts
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of compound scripts for automating ORCA quantum chemistry workflows
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts designed to facilitate and automate complex calculation workflows using the ORCA quantum chemistry software package.

tools.name: PARSEC Matlab
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB implementation of the PARSEC real-space electronic structure code
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based electronic structure code for molecules and clusters using real-space pseudopotentials and density functional theory (DFT).

tools.name: PennyLane
tools.one_line_profile: Cross-platform Python library for differentiable quantum computing
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform Python library for quantum computing, quantum machine learning, and quantum chemistry, enabling differentiable programming of quantum circuits.

tools.name: PennyLane-Rigetti
tools.one_line_profile: PennyLane plugin for Rigetti Forest QPUs and simulators
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for PennyLane that enables optimization of quantum circuits on Rigetti Forest QPUs, QVM, and wavefunction simulators.

tools.name: DFTTK
tools.one_line_profile: Density functional theory workflows for finite temperature thermodynamics
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing density functional theory (DFT) workflows based on Atomate for calculating finite temperature thermodynamic properties of materials.

tools.name: FermiLib-Plugin-Psi4
tools.one_line_profile: Psi4 plugin for FermiLib
tools.detailed_description: A plugin enabling the use of the Psi4 quantum chemistry package within the FermiLib ecosystem for quantum computing applications.

tools.name: FermiLib-Plugin-PySCF
tools.one_line_profile: PySCF plugin for FermiLib
tools.detailed_description: A plugin enabling the use of the PySCF quantum chemistry package within the FermiLib ecosystem for quantum computing applications.

tools.name: AaronTools
tools.one_line_profile: Automation tools for quantum chemistry computations
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for automating routine tasks in quantum chemistry, including input generation, output parsing, and structure manipulation.

tools.name: Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated suite for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling
tools.detailed_description: An integrated suite of Open-Source computer codes for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling at the nanoscale, based on density-functional theory, plane waves, and pseudopotentials.

tools.name: Quantum ESPRESSO for Schrödinger
tools.one_line_profile: Quantum ESPRESSO integration for Schrödinger Materials Science Suite
tools.detailed_description: A specialized version of Quantum ESPRESSO designed for integration into Schrödinger’s Materials Science Suite workflows.

tools.name: qexsd
tools.one_line_profile: Quantum ESPRESSO XML Schema Tools
tools.detailed_description: Python tools for handling and validating XML Schema based documents generated by Quantum ESPRESSO.

tools.name: TBSOC
tools.one_line_profile: Ab initio spin-orbital coupling strength calculator for Wannier models
tools.detailed_description: A tool to calculate ab initio spin-orbital coupling strength for Wannier tight-binding models.

tools.name: CHAMP
tools.one_line_profile: Cornell-Holland Ab-initio Materials Package
tools.detailed_description: A quantum Monte Carlo (QMC) code for electronic structure calculations of atoms, molecules, and solids.

tools.name: QMCPACK
tools.one_line_profile: Many-body ab initio Quantum Monte Carlo code
tools.detailed_description: An open-source, high-performance many-body ab initio Quantum Monte Carlo code for computing the electronic structure of atoms, molecules, and solids, with GPU support.

tools.name: Hefei-NAMD
tools.one_line_profile: Ab-initio nonadiabatic molecular dynamics program
tools.detailed_description: A software package for performing ab-initio nonadiabatic molecular dynamics simulations to study excited state dynamics.

tools.name: pyscf-ac0
tools.one_line_profile: PySCF extension for CAS-AC0 calculations
tools.detailed_description: An extension for the PySCF library implementing the CAS-AC0 method for electronic structure calculations.

tools.name: quacc
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible platform for computational materials science and quantum chemistry
tools.detailed_description: A platform for building and running complex computational materials science and quantum chemistry workflows, designed for high-throughput and big data applications.

tools.name: TightBindingApproximation.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia package for tight binding approximation of quantum lattice systems
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for modeling and simulating quantum lattice systems using the tight-binding approximation.

tools.name: Quantum Package
tools.one_line_profile: Programming environment for wave function methods
tools.detailed_description: An open-source programming environment and code for developing and running quantum chemistry wave function methods, particularly Configuration Interaction variants.

tools.name: RMG
tools.one_line_profile: Real-space Multigrid DFT code
tools.detailed_description: An open-source electronic structure code based on density functional theory (DFT) using real-space bases and pseudopotentials, suitable for materials and molecules.

tools.name: RadonPy
tools.one_line_profile: Automated physical property calculation library for polymers
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to automate the calculation of physical properties for polymer informatics, integrating MD and DFT workflows.

tools.name: ASH
tools.one_line_profile: Python-based computational chemistry and QM/MM environment
tools.detailed_description: A flexible Python environment for computational chemistry, focusing on QM/MM calculations for molecules, crystals, and proteins.

tools.name: ML-DFT
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning models for DFT property prediction of polymers
tools.detailed_description: A tool to predict electronic structure and atomic properties (potential energy, forces, stress) of polymers using machine learning trained on DFT data.

tools.name: SOAPLite
tools.one_line_profile: Fast lightweight SOAP implementation for machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A fast and lightweight implementation of the Smooth Overlap of Atomic Positions (SOAP) descriptor for machine learning in quantum chemistry and materials physics.

tools.name: pycp2k
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for CP2K
tools.detailed_description: A Python interface for the CP2K quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package, enabling scripted control of simulations.

tools.name: Sumo
tools.one_line_profile: Plotting tools for ab initio calculations
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for generating publication-quality plots (band structures, DOS, etc.) from ab initio calculation outputs (VASP, Questaal, CASTEP).

tools.name: M-SPARC
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB Simulation Package for Ab-initio Real-space Calculations
tools.detailed_description: The MATLAB implementation of the SPARC electronic structure code, using real-space finite-difference methods for DFT calculations.

tools.name: SPARC
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation Package for Ab-initio Real-space Calculations
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance C-based electronic structure code implementing real-space finite-difference methods for density functional theory.

tools.name: CellConstructor
tools.one_line_profile: Python utilities for atomic structure manipulation
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for handling atomic structures, phonon calculations, and interfacing with Quantum ESPRESSO and other formats.

tools.name: CoupledNMF
tools.one_line_profile: Coupled clustering tool for single cell genomic data
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for coupled Non-negative Matrix Factorization (NMF) clustering of single-cell genomic data.

tools.name: XtraCrysPy
tools.one_line_profile: Crystallographic visualizer for Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool for visualizing crystallographic structures and data from common quantum chemistry software like Quantum ESPRESSO, VASP, and CP2K.

tools.name: CheMPS2
tools.one_line_profile: Spin-adapted DMRG for ab initio quantum chemistry
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library and application implementing the spin-adapted Density Matrix Renormalization Group (DMRG) algorithm for ab initio quantum chemistry.

tools.name: QC-DMET
tools.one_line_profile: Density Matrix Embedding Theory implementation
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Density Matrix Embedding Theory (DMET) for performing ab initio quantum chemistry calculations.

tools.name: Merlin
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Vision Language Model for computed tomography analysis
tools.detailed_description: Merlin is a 3D Vision Language Model (VLM) designed for computed tomography (CT) scans. It utilizes structured electronic health records (EHR) and unstructured radiology reports for pretraining to enhance medical imaging analysis.

tools.name: SpecDis
tools.one_line_profile: Processing tool for quantum-chemical ECD/UV/ORD/VCD/IR calculations
tools.detailed_description: SpecDis is a tool designed to process and visualize results from quantum-chemical calculations such as ECD, UV, ORD, VCD, and IR spectra. It supports output formats from various packages including ORCA, Gaussian, Turbomole, and NWChem.

tools.name: MPQC
tools.one_line_profile: Massively Parallel Quantum Chemistry program
tools.detailed_description: MPQC (Massively Parallel Quantum Chemistry) is an ab initio quantum chemistry program designed to compute properties of atoms and molecules using the time-independent Schrödinger equation, optimized for massively parallel architectures.

tools.name: VeloxChem
tools.one_line_profile: Python-based quantum chemistry software for molecular properties
tools.detailed_description: VeloxChem is a Python-based open-source quantum chemistry software designed for computing molecular properties and various spectroscopies using response theory, with a focus on high-performance computing.

tools.name: PythonGroupAdditivity
tools.one_line_profile: First-Principles Semi-Empirical Group Additivity method
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the First-Principles Semi-Empirical (FPSE) Group Additivity (GA) method for estimating thermodynamic properties of molecules, developed by the Vlachos Group.

tools.name: workfunction
tools.one_line_profile: Planar averaged electrostatic potential calculator for VASP
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran tool to calculate the planar averaged electrostatic potential from VASP outputs, typically used for work function calculations in surface science.

tools.name: phononTB
tools.one_line_profile: Phonon tight-binding model construction and topological property calculation
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to construct phonon tight-binding models and calculate their topological properties, facilitating the study of phonon band structures.

tools.name: Hefei-NAMD
tools.one_line_profile: Ab initio non-adiabatic molecular dynamics program
tools.detailed_description: Hefei-NAMD is an ab initio non-adiabatic molecular dynamics program based on time-dependent density-functional theory (TDDFT) and surface hopping methods, designed to investigate ultrafast dynamics of excited carriers.

tools.name: GradDFT
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based library for differentiable design of XC functionals
tools.detailed_description: GradDFT is a JAX-based library that enables the differentiable design and experimentation of exchange-correlation functionals in Density Functional Theory (DFT) using machine learning techniques.

tools.name: EHRStruct
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark framework for evaluating LLMs on structured EHR tasks
tools.detailed_description: EHRStruct is a comprehensive benchmark framework designed to evaluate the performance of Large Language Models (LLMs) on tasks involving structured Electronic Health Records (EHR).

tools.name: TBmodels
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for creating and manipulating tight-binding models
tools.detailed_description: TBmodels is a Python tool for creating, manipulating, and evaluating tight-binding models, often used in conjunction with first-principles calculations to study electronic properties.

tools.name: fcdmft
tools.one_line_profile: Ab initio full cell dynamical mean-field theory (DMFT) code
tools.detailed_description: fcdmft implements ab initio full cell dynamical mean-field theory (DMFT) and GW+DMFT methods for calculating electronic properties of solids, developed by the Zhu Group at Yale.

tools.name: kccgf
tools.one_line_profile: Periodic coupled-cluster Green's function for solids
tools.detailed_description: kccgf is a code for performing periodic coupled-cluster Green's function calculations for realistic solids, developed by the Zhu Group at Yale.

tools.name: abTEM
tools.one_line_profile: Ab initio Transmission Electron Microscopy simulation
tools.detailed_description: abTEM is a Python code for ab initio simulations of Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM) images and diffraction patterns, providing a flexible interface for electron microscopy simulations.

tools.name: ABACUS
tools.one_line_profile: Electronic structure package using plane wave or numerical atomic orbitals
tools.detailed_description: ABACUS (Atomic-orbital Based Ab-initio Computation at UStc) is an electronic structure package based on Density Functional Theory (DFT) that supports both plane wave and numerical atomic orbital basis sets.

tools.name: AMLP
tools.one_line_profile: Automated workflow for machine learning interatomic potentials
tools.detailed_description: AMLP integrates dataset creation, input/output handling, and analysis for machine learning interatomic potentials. It supports interfaces with Gaussian, VASP, and CP2K and includes LLM agents for code selection.

tools.name: Quantum ESPRESSO (AdvanceSoft)
tools.one_line_profile: Redistributed binaries and sources of Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains compiled binaries and source code for Quantum ESPRESSO, an integrated suite of Open-Source computer codes for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling at the nanoscale.

tools.name: aiidalab-qe
tools.one_line_profile: AiiDAlab App for Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: AiiDAlab-QE is an application for the AiiDAlab platform that provides a graphical interface and workflow management for running Quantum ESPRESSO calculations.

tools.name: aiida-cp2k
tools.one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for CP2K
tools.detailed_description: The official AiiDA plugin for CP2K, enabling the integration of CP2K calculations into AiiDA workflows for automated and reproducible computational chemistry.

tools.name: aiida-quantumespresso
tools.one_line_profile: AiiDA plugin for Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: The official AiiDA plugin for Quantum ESPRESSO, allowing for the automation and management of Quantum ESPRESSO calculations within the AiiDA framework.

tools.name: qe-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Python tools for Quantum ESPRESSO
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python tools for parsing and manipulating Quantum ESPRESSO input and output files, often used in conjunction with AiiDA.

tools.name: ANI1x_datasets
tools.one_line_profile: ANI-1ccx and ANI-1x datasets for organic molecules
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing the ANI-1ccx and ANI-1x datasets, which provide coupled-cluster and density functional theory properties for organic molecules, used for training machine learning potentials.

tools.name: Py_xDH
tools.one_line_profile: XYG3 type density functional implementation in PySCF
tools.detailed_description: Py_xDH provides an implementation of the XYG3 type doubly hybrid density functionals and their 2nd derivatives within the PySCF framework.

tools.name: tightbinder
tools.one_line_profile: Slater-Koster tight-binding library
tools.detailed_description: tightbinder is a general-purpose Python library for performing Slater-Koster tight-binding electronic structure calculations.

tools.name: Gabedit
tools.one_line_profile: GUI for computational chemistry packages
tools.detailed_description: Gabedit is a graphical user interface for various computational chemistry packages (Gaussian, Molcas, Molpro, etc.), facilitating input generation and result visualization.

tools.name: DFTAtom
tools.one_line_profile: Real-space DFT solver for atoms
tools.detailed_description: DFTAtom is a C++ program for performing Density Functional Theory calculations on atoms using real-space methods, supporting LDA and LSDA.

tools.name: DFTQuantumDot
tools.one_line_profile: DFT solver for quantum dots with plane waves
tools.detailed_description: DFTQuantumDot is a C++ code for Density Functional Theory calculations on quantum dots using a plane wave basis, including volumetric visualization capabilities.

tools.name: HartreeFock
tools.one_line_profile: Hartree-Fock and post-HF method implementation
tools.detailed_description: A C++ program implementing Hartree-Fock and post-Hartree-Fock methods (MP2, CCSD(T), CIS, TDHF/RPA) using Gaussian orbitals.

tools.name: xtb-gaussian
tools.one_line_profile: Wrapper to run GFN-xTB semi-empirical methods within Gaussian
tools.detailed_description: A Perl wrapper script that allows the Gaussian quantum chemistry package to utilize the GFN-xTB (Extended Tight Binding) method as an external theory level, enabling xTB to be used in Gaussian workflows like ONIOM or geometry optimizations.

tools.name: gxtb-torch
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of the GFN-xTB quantum chemistry method
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable implementation of the GFN-xTB (Geometry, Frequency, Non-Covalent Interaction, Extended Tight Binding) method using PyTorch, facilitating gradient-based optimization and integration with machine learning workflows.

tools.name: featom
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Element Solvers for Atomic Structure Calculations
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran-based solver utilizing finite element methods for performing high-precision atomic structure calculations, suitable for studying electronic properties of atoms.

tools.name: SchNOrb
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for predicting molecular wavefunctions
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning architecture that unifies machine learning and quantum chemistry by predicting molecular wavefunctions and energy levels, enabling access to electronic properties beyond scalar energy values.

tools.name: SchNet
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning architecture for quantum chemistry and atomistic systems
tools.detailed_description: A continuous-filter convolutional neural network for modeling quantum interactions in molecules and materials, capable of predicting potential energy surfaces and force fields with high accuracy.

tools.name: CP2K Editor
tools.one_line_profile: GUI for generating CP2K input files
tools.detailed_description: A graphical user interface designed to simplify the creation of complex input files for the CP2K atomistic simulation software, helping users manage parameters for DFT and MD simulations.

tools.name: ampsci
tools.one_line_profile: High-precision atomic structure calculations for valence systems
tools.detailed_description: A C++ program for calculating atomic structures of one and two valence systems using the Hartree-Fock method plus correlation potential, capable of computing ionisation cross sections.

tools.name: HubbardMF
tools.one_line_profile: Mean-field Hartree-Fock solver for the Hubbard model
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that solves the Hubbard model using the mean-field Hartree-Fock approximation, useful for studying strongly correlated electron systems in condensed matter physics.

tools.name: PROPhet
tools.one_line_profile: Integration of machine learning with first-principles quantum chemistry
tools.detailed_description: A code designed to interface machine learning techniques with ab initio quantum chemistry approaches, facilitating the development of ML-enhanced electronic structure methods.

tools.name: CP2K_qmmm_input_preparation_scripts
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for preparing CP2K QM/MM input files
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python scripts developed by BioExcel to assist in the setup and generation of input files for QM/MM simulations using CP2K.

tools.name: block2
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient parallel DMRG solver for quantum chemistry
tools.detailed_description: An efficient, parallel implementation of the Density Matrix Renormalization Group (DMRG) algorithm in the Matrix Product Operator (MPO) formalism for quantum chemistry calculations.

tools.name: mpnn
tools.one_line_profile: Neural Message Passing for Quantum Chemistry
tools.detailed_description: Reference implementation of the Neural Message Passing for Quantum Chemistry (MPNN) architecture, used for predicting molecular properties from graph representations.

tools.name: lfdft
tools.one_line_profile: DFT with Finite Difference and Lagrange Function Basis Sets
